intro: Orthocarpus tenuis, commonly known as slender orthocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in regions of Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and is often found in grasslands or along rocky outcrops. Its leaves are narrow and pinnately divided, contributing to its distinctive botanical appearance. Orthocarpus tenuis is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
